name: Rooster Tale (2D Platformer)
description:
Wish List


Are you tired of the same old games? Then it's time to shake things up with our rooster tale game. Trust me, once you add it to your wishlist, you'll be crowing with joy. (Get it? Because it's a rooster game...) So what are you waiting for? Go ahead and give it a try!

Overview


In our 2D platformer game, players take on the role of a brave rooster who must rescue chickens kidnapped by the evil fox and his robotic minions. The chickens have been hidden in various locations, and players must use their wits and platforming skills to overcome challenging obstacles, defeat the fox's robots, and save the chickens.



With pixel graphics and a retro aesthetic, our game offers a unique blend of adventure, puzzle-solving, and action. Players will need quick reflexes and strategic thinking to survive the fox's traps and hazards, and to outsmart his robotic henchmen.



Filled with cute characters and challenging levels, our game is a must-play for fans of indie, adventure, and puzzle platformers. Whether you're a seasoned platformer veteran or a newcomer to the genre, you'll find plenty of excitement and challenge in our game.



Join the rooster on his quest to save the chickens, and prove that even the smallest hero can triumph against impossible odds!



Difficult: This game will likely be challenging and require the player to use their skills and strategies to overcome obstacles and enemies.
Adventure: The player will embark on a thrilling adventure as they rescue chickens and battle robots.
Puzzle: The game may contain puzzles that the player must solve in order to progress.
Action: The player will engage in fast-paced action as they run, jump, and fight their way through the game.
Side Scroller: The game will likely have a side-scrolling format, with the player moving from left to right across the screen.
Retro: The pixel art style of the game will give it a nostalgic, retro feel.
Platformer: The game will be a platformer, with the player jumping and running across platforms to reach their goal.
Strategy: The player will need to use strategy and planning to successfully rescue the chickens and defeat the robots.
Challenge: The game will present the player with a series of challenges that they must overcome in order to succeed.
Jump: The player will need to jump to avoid obstacles and reach high platforms.
Run: The player will need to run quickly to escape from enemies and navigate through the game's levels.

Story


Once upon a time, in a far-off land, there was a brave rooster who lived on a farm with his flock of chickens. However, a sly fox began to steal the chickens, one by one, using robotic henchmen to whisk them away to hidden locations. Determined to rescue his chickens, the rooster embarked on a perilous journey to track down the fox and his minions. Along the way, the rooster discovered he had the ability to shoot fire from his beak, which he used to fight off the robotic henchmen and rescue the chickens. Eventually, the rooster reached the fox's stronghold and engaged in a fierce battle. Despite facing many challenges and obstacles, the rooster never lost hope and ultimately emerged victorious, defeating the fox and rescuing the last of his chickens. The rooster returned home a hero, and the chickens lived happily ever after, safe and sound thanks to their brave and valiant protector. The end.

Developer Story


As a solo indie game developer, creating my first game, Rooster Tale, has been a challenging but incredibly rewarding experience. The game follows the adventures of a rooster named Rooster as he navigates through various levels filled with obstacles and enemies.



I wanted the game to have a retro feel, so I chose to use pixel graphics and incorporate elements of adventure and puzzle platforming. Making the game challenging is also important to me, so I have spent a lot of time playtesting and fine-tuning the difficulty to ensure it is just right.



The process of developing Rooster Tale has not been without its obstacles. There have been many late nights spent coding and troubleshooting, as well as moments of self-doubt where I have questioned whether I am capable of seeing the project through to the end. However, the sense of accomplishment I will feel when I finally finish and publish the game will be worth all of the hard work.



I am excited to say that Rooster Tale is still in development and I am hard at work on completing it. I hope that those who play the game will enjoy the challenges and adventures that Rooster encounters on his journey.
